PHOTOCATALYTIC PURIFICATION OF SOIL CONTAMINATED WITH OIL USING MODIFIED TiO2 POWDERS

funder.name: German Federal Ministry for Education and Research

items.abstract: <jats:p>This study examined the photocatalytic degradation of phenol and azo dyes such as Reactive Red 198 and Direct Green 99 by photocatalysis over amorphous hydrated titanium dioxide (TiO<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>· H<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>O) obtained directly from the sulphate technology installation modified in gaseous ammonia atmosphere. The photocatalysts were used in the solution and coated on the glass plate after sandblasting. The highest rate of phenol degradation in the solution was obtained for catalysts calcinated at 700<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="E1"><mml:mo>°</mml:mo></mml:math>C (<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="E2"><mml:mo>6.5</mml:mo></mml:math>% wt.), and the highest rate of dye decolorization was found for catalysts calcinated at 500<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="E3"><mml:mo>°</mml:mo></mml:math>C and 600<mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="E4"><mml:mo>°</mml:mo></mml:math>C (ca. 40%–45%). Some TOC measurements of dye solutions were performed to check the rate of mineralization. On the glass plate, the decomposition of DG99 on TiO<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>/N 500 contrary to TiO<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>-P25 proceeded completely after 120 hours of visible light irradiation. The prolongation of the time of irradiation did not enhance DG99 degradation on TiO<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>-P25. The decomposition of the Direct Green 99 on TiO<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>/N 500 coated on the glass plate covered with liquid glass took place up to 24 hours of irradiation. The liquid layer on the glass plate which was covered with the photocatalyst reduced its activity. The nitrogen doping during calcinations under ammonia atmosphere is a new way of obtaining a photocatalyst which could have a practical application in water treatment system under broadened solar light spectrum as well as self-cleaning coatings.</jats:p>
title: Preparation of TiO2-nitrogen-doped photocatalyst active under visible light

short-container-title: Papers of the Regional Science Association
title: Balances of interregional commodity flows in Poland: A value approach

reference.unstructured: As a rule, services are not objects of exchange among regions: they are consumed at the place of their production. However, a difference in the origin of the service and the location of the subject consuming it,is possible, as in the case of tourist services.

In the consideration of commodity flows, “other benefits” have been singled out as one of the three principal forms of exchange. With respect to socialist economies, the following examples of “other benefits” may be listed: pensions, scholarships, donations, education, results of scientific research, management and information.
